item.lotr.harad_warlord_helmet: Elmo da Signore della Guerra haradrico
gui.lotr.map.title: Mappa %s
gui.lotr.map.locked.enemy: Questo waypoint non Ã¨ disponibile per i giocatori nemici
gui.lotr.map.locked.region: Sblocca questo waypoint visitando la sua regione
gui.lotr.map.fastTravel.prompt: Premi â%sâ per viaggiare velocemente verso il waypoint selezionato
gui.lotr.map.fastTravel.moreTime: Puoi viaggiare velocemente verso il waypoint selezionato tra: %s
gui.lotr.map.fastTravel.waitTime: (Tempo di attesa per il waypoint: %s. Diminuisce dopo ogni viaggio)
waypoint.lotr.himling.lore: Il picco della collina di Himring, sprofondata quasi del tutto dopo la Guerra d'Ira.
waypoint.lotr.tol_fuin.lore: Gli altopiani di Taur-nu-Fuin, la Foresta sotto la Notte, sopravvissuti allo sprofondamento del Beleriand.
waypoint.lotr.tol_morwen.lore: Una collina solitaria risparmiata dallo sprofondamento del Beleriand, sulla quale giace la tomba di Morwen madre di TÃºrin Turambar.
waypoint.lotr.hobbiton.lore: Una cittadina Hobbit al centro della Contea, sovrastata dalla Collina di Casa Baggins.
waypoint.lotr.brandywine_bridge.lore: Un ponte di pietra sul fiume Brandivino, l'ingresso orientale della Contea.
waypoint.lotr.sarn_ford.lore: Un guado roccioso al confine meridionale della Contea. Sebbene il popolo della Contea non lo sappia, Ã¨ attentamente sorvegliato.
waypoint.lotr.longbottom.lore: Una cittadina situata nel Decumano Sud della Contea, famosa per la sua erba pipa.
waypoint.lotr.michel_delving.lore: Cittadina capoluogo della Contea, situata ai piedi dei Bianchi Poggi, dimora del Sindaco di Pianilungone.
waypoint.lotr.willowbottom.lore: Un piccolo villaggio vicino a Fine di Foresta.
waypoint.lotr.bucklebury.lore: Ã il maggiore insediamento della Terra di Buck, sede del Signore della Terra di Buck.
waypoint.lotr.whitfurrows.lore: Una piccola cittadina sulla Via Est.
waypoint.lotr.frogmorton.lore: Un villaggio sulla Via Est vicino alle Paludi delle Rane.
waypoint.lotr.oatbarton.lore: Un villaggio nel Decumano Nord della Contea.
waypoint.lotr.scary.lore: Un piccolo villaggio Hobbit tra grotte e colline rocciose.
waypoint.lotr.needlehole.lore: Una cittadina nel Decumano Ovest della Contea.
waypoint.lotr.little_delving.lore: Una piccola cittadina Hobbit sui Bianchi Poggi.
waypoint.lotr.waymeet.lore: Una cittadina posta all'incrocio tra importanti strade della Contea.
waypoint.lotr.tuckborough.lore: Una storica cittÃ  della Regione delle Verdi Colline. Sede della famiglia Tuc, i Conti della Contea.
waypoint.lotr.nobottle.lore: Una cittadina nel Decumano Ovest della Contea.
waypoint.lotr.tighfield.lore: Un villaggio noto per i suoi cordai.
waypoint.lotr.brockenborings.lore: Un labirinto di tunnel all'interno delle colline rocciose che circondano Scary.
waypoint.lotr.deephallow.lore: Un villaggio sulle rive del fiume Brandivino.
waypoint.lotr.stock.lore: Una cittadina sul ruscello di Scorta, vicino alle rive del fiume Brandivino.
waypoint.lotr.bywater.lore: Un villaggio vicino alla Pozza sull'Acqua, sede della famosa locanda del Drago Verde.
waypoint.lotr.overhill.lore: Un piccolo villaggio a Nord di Hobbiton e della Collina.
waypoint.lotr.haysend.lore: Un villaggio nel Sud della Terra di Buck alla fine della Siepe.
waypoint.lotr.hay_gate.lore: La sorvegliata Porta Nord nella Siepe della Terra di Buck.
waypoint.lotr.greenholm.lore: Una piccola cittadina sui Colli Remoti al confine occidentale della Contea.
waypoint.lotr.withywindle_valley.lore: Una valle strana e spettrale in cui il Sinuosalice attraversa la Vecchia Foresta.
waypoint.lotr.forlond.lore: A harbour-city of the Elves on the northern shore of the Gulf of Lune.
waypoint.lotr.harlond.lore: A harbour-city of the Elves on the southern shore of the Gulf of Lune.
waypoint.lotr.north_mithlond.lore: The northern half of Mithlond, the Grey Havens, where CÃ­rdan the Shipwright dwells with his people.
waypoint.lotr.south_mithlond.lore: The southern half of Mithlond, the Grey Havens, where CÃ­rdan the Shipwright dwells with his people.
waypoint.lotr.forlindon.lore: The northern regions of the fair country of Lindon.
waypoint.lotr.harlindon.lore: The southern regions of the fair country of Lindon.
waypoint.lotr.elostirion.lore: Tallest of the White Towers built for Elendil by Gil-galad, said to house one of the Seeing Stones of Arnor.
waypoint.lotr.amon_ereb.lore: An ancient hill in Lindon, which, long ago in the Elder Days, was a lookout-post of great importance.
waypoint.lotr.belegost.lore: An ancient Dwarven city of the Blue Mountains, dating back to the Elder Days. It was destroyed after the War of Wrath, but later resettled, in part.
waypoint.lotr.nogrod.lore: An ancient Dwarven city of the Blue Mountains, dating back to the Elder Days. It was destroyed after the War of Wrath, but later resettled, in part.
waypoint.lotr.mount_rerir.lore: A large mountain ruined long ago during the War of Wrath. In Elder Days a fortress of Caranthir son of FÃ«anor stood upon its slopes.
waypoint.lotr.mount_dolmed.lore: Said to be the awakening-place of two Fathers of the Dwarves, this mountain was cloven in the War of Wrath and diminished in size.
waypoint.lotr.thorins_halls.lore: Once ruled by Thorin Oakenshield, this settlement in the Blue Mountains is inhabited by Dwarves mostly of Durin's Folk.
waypoint.lotr.arveduis_mines.lore: Abandoned mines in the Blue Mountains. The last King of Arnor and his company once hid here to escape the threat of Angmar.
waypoint.lotr.thrains_halls.lore: A Dwarven settlement, founded by ThrÃ¡in and the exiles of the Lonely Mountain, with many old mines still in use today.
waypoint.lotr.north_downs.lore: A range of hills in northern Eriador with the ancient city of Fornost Erain at their southwestern end.
waypoint.lotr.south_downs.lore: A range of hills in Eriador.
waypoint.lotr.eryn_vorn.lore: These dark woodlands are among the last remnants of the ancient forest that once covered all Eriador.
waypoint.lotr.tharbad.lore: An old ford-town in Eriador, deserted following the Great Plague.
waypoint.lotr.fornost.lore: Fornost Erain, the ruined capital of Arnor. Known as Kings' Norbury in the Common Tongue.
waypoint.lotr.annuminas.lore: The old capital of Arnor, the North-kingdom, before it was abandoned in favour of Fornost Erain.
waypoint.lotr.greenway_crossroads.lore: The crossing of the great East-West and North-South roads.
waypoint.lotr.bree.lore: The chief town of the Bree-land, known for its cheerful Men and Hobbits.
waypoint.lotr.staddle.lore: A town of Hobbits in the Bree-land.
waypoint.lotr.combe.lore: A village of Men on the road to the Chetwood.
waypoint.lotr.archet.lore: A town of the Bree-folk on the edge of the Chetwood with a lively logging trade.
waypoint.lotr.forsaken_inn.lore: A day's ride east of Bree, this lonely inn is the last settlement of Men before the wild lands.
waypoint.lotr.weathertop.lore: The ruined watchtower of Amon SÃ»l. In olden days it housed one of the great Seeing Stones of Arnor.
waypoint.lotr.last_bridge.lore: The last bridge on the Great East Road before the Misty Mountains.
waypoint.lotr.old_elven_way.lore: An old road once travelled by Elves of Eregion.
waypoint.lotr.rivendell.lore: The hidden valley of Imladris, where Lord Elrond dwells with his people in the Last Homely House East of the Sea.
waypoint.lotr.ford_of_bruinen.lore: The shallow ford crossing the Loudwater into the realm of Rivendell.
waypoint.lotr.trollshaws.lore: A wild and outlandish forest, scattered with old castles and ruins of Rhudaur, and dark caves home to Trolls from the mountains.
waypoint.lotr.carn_dum.lore: The capital of the old Kingdom of Angmar.
waypoint.lotr.west_gate.lore: The western gate of Khazad-dÃ»m, now called Moria: of old the great delvings and mansions of the Dwarves of Durin's Folk and a wonder of the Northern world.
waypoint.lotr.ost_in_edhil.lore: The ruined city of the Elves of Eregion.
waypoint.lotr.duneard.lore: A village of shepherds and hunters in the northern reaches of Dunland.
waypoint.lotr.firwold.lore: A town of middling size in the highs of Dunland, and a stop for many traders and travellers on their journeys through the region.
waypoint.lotr.fords_of_isen.lore: These shallow fords across the River Isen into Rohan are often the site of skirmishes between the Rohirrim and the Orcs.
waypoint.lotr.dwarrowvale.lore: A Dunlending village grown up around the site of an old hamlet, which, it is said, once hosted ThrÃ¡in and Thorin Oakenshield during their long wanderings in the wild.
waypoint.lotr.wulfburg.lore: Once the fortress of Freca's son, the self-styled 'King' Wulf, who seized Meduseld for Dunland during the reign of Helm Hammerhand.
waypoint.lotr.lond_daer.lore: The ancient ruins of the first NÃºmenÃ³rean haven in Middle-earth.
waypoint.lotr.old_south_road.lore: With the North-kingdom long fallen and the power of the South-kingdom waning, these stretches of the old Royal Road have long since fallen into ruin.
waypoint.lotr.mouths_of_isen.lore: Here the River Isen flows into the Sea after its long course through sparsely-inhabited Enedwaith.
waypoint.lotr.isengard.lore: A great fortified ring of stone within a vale of the Misty Mountains, wherein stands the tower of Orthanc, stronghold of Saruman.
waypoint.lotr.cape_of_forochel.lore: The perilous floes of the Icebay, where only the Snowmen of Forochel dare wander.
waypoint.lotr.south_forochel.lore: One of few permanent settlements of the Lossoth among the frozen wastes.
waypoint.lotr.withered_heath.lore: A scorched valley in the Grey Mountains where, it is said, lurk the last of the Fire-drakes.
waypoint.lotr.mount_gundabad.lore: The mountain beneath which Durin the Deathless awoke in the Elder Days, and a sacred site of the Dwarves before being overrun by Orcs.
waypoint.lotr.mount_gram.lore: A mountain inhabited by Orcs who often trouble the lands of Eriador.
waypoint.lotr.high_pass.lore: A long and perilous mountain pass from Eriador into Wilderland.
waypoint.lotr.mount_caradhras.lore: The Redhorn, one of three peaks above the delvings of Khazad-dÃ»m. The mountain is called Caradhras the Cruel and is said to have a will of its own.
waypoint.lotr.mount_celebdil.lore: The Silvertine, one of the peaks above Khazad-dÃ»m. Upon its summit stands the fabled Durin's Tower.
waypoint.lotr.mount_fanuidhol.lore: The Cloudyhead, one of three peaks above the realm of Khazad-dÃ»m.
waypoint.lotr.mount_methedras.lore: The Last Peak, southermost of the Misty Mountains, whence flow the Rivers Isen and Entwash.
waypoint.lotr.goblin_town.lore: A warren of weaving tunnels and caverns beneath the High Pass, where Orcs scutter and scrape in the dark.
waypoint.lotr.eagles_eyrie.lore: A great shelf of rock on the eastern side of the Misty Mountains that can be reached only by flight. The Eagles of ManwÃ« reside here.
waypoint.lotr.dains_halls.lore: A colony of Durin's Folk in the Grey Mountains, abandoned after DÃ¡in was slain by a Cold-drake.
waypoint.lotr.scathas_lair.lore: Once the lair of Scatha, a great Long-worm, before he was slain by Fram of the ÃothÃ©od.
waypoint.lotr.carrock.lore: A towering pillar of rock in the midst of the Great River. It was once said that, on clear nights, a great bear could be seen climbing the rock to gaze upon the Moon.
waypoint.lotr.old_ford.lore: The crossing of the Old Forest Road upon the Great River of Wilderland. A bridge once stood here, but has long since crumbled.
waypoint.lotr.gladden_confluence.lore: The watery meeting-place where the Gladden flows down into the Great River Anduin.
waypoint.lotr.dimrill_dale.lore: Azanulbizar, below the East Gate of Khazad-dÃ»m: the valley of the Mirrormere, wherein it is said Durin the Deathless first saw his crown among the stars.
waypoint.lotr.field_of_celebrant.lore: The site of the Gondor-ÃothÃ©od victory over the Balchoth, which led to the historic Oath of Cirion and Eorl.
waypoint.lotr.rauros.lore: The shores of Parth Galen by the great falls of Rauros.
waypoint.lotr.beorns_hall.lore: A rustic homestead inhabited by skin-changers and men of the Vales, said to be unfriendly to outsiders.
waypoint.lotr.forest_gate.lore: Once the entrance to the Wood-elven realm in Greenwood the Great, the gate of Mirkwood is now defiled by servants of the Enemy.
waypoint.lotr.framsburg.lore: The ruined city of the ÃothÃ©od, Northmen ancestors of the Rohirrim.
waypoint.lotr.east_rhovanion_gate.lore: An old crossroads at the meeting of the Anduin Vales, the Brown Lands, and eastern Wilderland.
waypoint.lotr.thranduils_halls.lore: The underground halls of Thranduil the Elvenking. It is said that they recall the glory of Menegroth in days of old.
waypoint.lotr.dol_guldur.lore: The Hill of Sorcery: fortress-lair of the Necromancer before he fled eastwards, now inhabited by KhamÃ»l the Easterling and his fell servants.
waypoint.lotr.mirkwood_mountains.lore: The Emyn-nu-Fuin, a range of dark hills rising out of the fog of Mirkwood, which fence out the worst of the Necromancer's corruption.
waypoint.lotr.rhosgobel.lore: The dwelling-place of Radagast the Brown, home to many birds and beasts, and a safe haven among the corruption of Mirkwood.
waypoint.lotr.enchanted_river.lore: Here the Elf-path crosses over a gloomy black river. It is advised to avoid these waters, for whoever touches them shall not awake...
waypoint.lotr.river_gate.lore: An outpost of the Wood-elves at the end of the Old Forest Road, where it meets the River Running.
waypoint.lotr.east_bight.lore: Once a thriving region of the Greenwood, the axes of Men have reduced it to a field of stumps and broken trees.
waypoint.lotr.old_rhovanion.lore: Long ago, these lands were held by a great Mannish kingdom of Rhovanion, but now its ruins are all that remain.
waypoint.lotr.dorwinion_crossroads.lore: A crossing in the great roads of Dale and Dorwinion.
waypoint.lotr.erebor.lore: The Lonely Mountain. Herein lies the Kingdom under the Mountain, a realm of Durin's Folk.
waypoint.lotr.dale.lore: The prosperous city of the Kingdom of Dale at the foot of the Lonely Mountain. It was destroyed by Smaug the Terrible in days of old, but rebuilt under King Bard.
waypoint.lotr.long_lake.lore: Upon the Long Lake stands Lake-town, a Northman settlement bustling with trade. Great wealth flows through this town out of Dale and onward to southern lands.
waypoint.lotr.running_ford.lore: A shallow ford on the River Running where the road runs south to old Rhovanion.
waypoint.lotr.redwater_ford.lore: A ford on the Redwater at the eastern border of the Kingdom of Dale, upon the ancient East-West Road laid by the Dwarves.
waypoint.lotr.great_dalish_crossroads.lo: At the meeting of several important Dalish roads, the lands around this crossing are home to many guilds and thriving markets.
waypoint.lotr.bardhaven.lore: The southern port of the Kingdom of Dale, and an important point on the trade routes of Dorwinion.
waypoint.lotr.west_peak.lore: The nearer of two large peaks in the Iron Hills. Beneath are the halls of DÃ¡in Ironfoot.
waypoint.lotr.east_peak.lore: A large mountain at the far eastern end of the Iron Hills.
waypoint.lotr.caras_galadhon.lore: The city of the Galadhrim in LothlÃ³rien, and the heart of Elvendom on earth.
waypoint.lotr.cerin_amroth.lore: A great green hill in the midst of LothlÃ³rien from where it is said one may see as far as southern Mirkwood.
waypoint.lotr.house_of_nimrodel.lore: The former home of an Elf-maiden, Nimrodel, who disappeared grieving after her beloved Amroth was drowned in the Sundering Seas.
waypoint.lotr.derndingle.lore: A meeting-place for the Ents of Fangorn, set within a hidden clearing.
waypoint.lotr.wellinghall.lore: One of Treebeard's Ent-houses nestled among the spurs of Mount Methedras.
waypoint.lotr.treebeards_hill.lore: A rocky shelf, standing above the trees of Fangorn Forest, where one can contemplate the sunlight on the leaves and the wind among their branches.
waypoint.lotr.woldhall.lore: A small town in the sparsely inhabited uplands of Rohan.
waypoint.lotr.edoras.lore: The chief city of the Riddermark, built upon a hill crowned with the Golden Hall of Meduseld.
waypoint.lotr.helms_deep.lore: The great Rohirric fortress of the Hornburg, which stands in a wide vale beneath the Thrihyrne. Men say that its Deeping Wall has never to this day been breached.
waypoint.lotr.deeping_coomb.lore: The vale at the foot of Helm's Deep.
waypoint.lotr.mering_stream.lore: This stream marks the border between Rohan and Gondor. It runs through Firienholt, the Whispering Wood.
waypoint.lotr.entwade.lore: A ford across the river Entwash, bridging the Eastemnet and the Westemnet.
waypoint.lotr.eastmark.lore: The heart of the wide lands patrolled by the eastern Riders of Rohan.
waypoint.lotr.aldburg.lore: The first capital of Rohan, Aldburg is the oldest town in the Riddermark and the seat of the Third Marshal of the Rohirrim.
waypoint.lotr.grimslade.lore: The home of Grimbold, a Marshal of the Riddermark.
waypoint.lotr.corsairs_landing.lore: In the days of Helm Hammerhand, a fleet of Southrons landed here and fought alongside the Dunlendings to defeat the Men of Rohan.
waypoint.lotr.frecas_hold.lore: The old fort raised by the heedless Lord Freca, who ruled the lands around the River Adorn, and was said to be part-Dunlending.
waypoint.lotr.dunharrow.lore: A refuge of the Rohirrim beneath the Dwimorberg, the Haunted Mountain. It is said that none living may pass the Paths of the Dead.
waypoint.lotr.tarlangs_neck.lore: Men say that a giant fell here and broke his neck, forming the mountain pass between the Blackroot Vale and Lamedon.
waypoint.lotr.ras_morthil.lore: The last peak at the headland of the western White Mountains. The Men of Anfalas say that wild PÃºkel-men still linger in these lands.
waypoint.lotr.minas_tirith.lore: The great Tower of Guard, capital city of the kingdom of Gondor, built of seven levels of pure white stone with the bright Tower of Ecthelion at its summit.
waypoint.lotr.cair_andros.lore: A fortified island in the Anduin, named for the white foam of the waters that run beside it.
waypoint.lotr.halifirien.lore: The Holy Mountain, westernmost of the beacon-hills of Gondor. Elendil was once entombed here, and Cirion and Eorl swore their Oath upon its slopes.
waypoint.lotr.calenhad.lore: The sixth beacon-hill, lit only in times of urgency.
waypoint.lotr.min_rimmon.lore: The fifth beacon-hill and one of the oldest, established before the founding of Rohan.
waypoint.lotr.erelas.lore: The fourth beacon-hill of Gondor. Bare and treeless, it is easily sighted from the surrounding lands.
waypoint.lotr.nardol.lore: The third beacon-hill, built on a stretch of the White Mountains. On a clear night its fire is said to be seen all the way from the Halifirien.
waypoint.lotr.eilenach.lore: The second beacon-hill from Minas Tirith, and the highest point of the DrÃºadan Forest.
waypoint.lotr.amon_din.lore: The Silent Hill is the closest beacon to Minas Tirith. Overlooking northern Ithilien, it serves as a fortified outpost for the White City.
waypoint.lotr.west_osgiliath.lore: The crumbling western half of Gondorâs former capital city. Garrisons are housed here to hold the Anduin under Gondorian control.
waypoint.lotr.east_osgiliath.lore: The ruined eastern half of Gondorâs former capital city, now often the site of clashes between Gondorians and Orcs.
waypoint.lotr.emyn_arnen.lore: In better days these hills were the residence of some noble and wealthy Gondorian families, including the House of the Stewards.
waypoint.lotr.henneth_annun.lore: The Forbidden Pool of Ithilien, where the Window-curtain waterfall masks a secret refuge.
waypoint.lotr.crossroads_of_the_fallen_k: These neglected crossroads once housed a majestic statue of a King, which, though now ruined, still wears a coronal of silver and gold.
waypoint.lotr.north_ithilien.lore: The northern reaches of the Land of the Moon.
waypoint.lotr.crossings_of_poros.lore: The crossing into Harondor over the River Poros. Nearby stands a great mound, wherein rest the twin sons of King Folcwine of Rohan.
waypoint.lotr.pelargir.lore: The great royal havens of the Ship-kings: the chief harbour of Gondor.
waypoint.lotr.linhir.lore: A river-town in southern Gondor upon the road from Pelargir to Ethring.
waypoint.lotr.ethir_anduin.lore: The Mouths of Anduin, home to poor fisher-folk of Gondor.
waypoint.lotr.imloth_melui.lore: The sweet Valley of Roses within Lossarnach.
waypoint.lotr.crossings_of_erui.lore: The fords of the River Erui in Lossarnach. Many Gondorians once perished here in the Kin-strife.
waypoint.lotr.calembel.lore: A town in Lamedon near the fords of the River Ciril, with few inhabitants.
waypoint.lotr.ethring.lore: A long bridge in the RinglÃ³ Vale on the road from Pelargir to Erech.
waypoint.lotr.erech.lore: A great steep hill, believed to be haunted, and known for the mysterious black stone which stands upon the summit.
waypoint.lotr.pinnath_gelin.lore: The beautiful Green Hills of Gondor.
waypoint.lotr.dol_amroth.lore: A mighty castle and city upon the shores of Belfalas, ruled by the Prince of Dol Amroth, a subject of Gondor.
waypoint.lotr.edhellond.lore: An ancient harbour of the Sindar in southern Gondor. The Elves who once dwelt at these havens sailed West long ago.
waypoint.lotr.tarnost.lore: A city in Gondor built in ancient days by Elves who have long since sailed West.
waypoint.lotr.tolfalas.lore: A bleak abandoned isle in the Bay of Belfalas.
waypoint.lotr.amon_hen.lore: The Hill of Sight, an ancient seat of Gondorian power.
waypoint.lotr.amon_lhaw.lore: The Hill of Hearing, an ancient seat of Gondorian power.
waypoint.lotr.argonath.lore: The Pillars of the Kings: two mighty statues of Isildur and AnÃ¡rion beside the Anduin, which guard what was once the northern border of Gondor.
waypoint.lotr.north_undeep.lore: The northern of two westward bends in the Great River Anduin. The shallow fords of the Undeeps were often used by armies as a crossing-point.
waypoint.lotr.south_undeep.lore: The southern of two westward bends in the Great River Anduin. The shallow fords of the Undeeps were often used by armies as a crossing-point.
waypoint.lotr.black_gate.lore: The great gates of Mordor, wrought of twisted steel and dark stone. None pass unless the Eye of the Dark Tower wills it.
waypoint.lotr.udun.lore: The Orc-infested vale behind the Black Gates. Named in imitation of UdÃ»n, the first fortress of Morgoth, also called Utumno.
waypoint.lotr.mount_doom.lore: Orodruin, the great Fire-mountain in the heart of Mordor, wherein Sauron forged the One Ring long ago.
waypoint.lotr.barad_dur.lore: The Dark Tower: fortress of Sauron, Lord of the Earth, and the seat from which all the evil hosts of Mordor are bent to his will.
waypoint.lotr.minas_morgul.lore: Once Minas Ithil, the fair Tower of the Moon; now a dark and sickly place ruled by the Lord of the NazgÃ»l.
waypoint.lotr.durthang.lore: A powerful Orcish stronghold built upon the slopes of Ephel DÃºath.
waypoint.lotr.carach_angren.lore: The Iron Teeth, a guarded mountain pass between UdÃ»n and the plateau of Gorgoroth.
waypoint.lotr.cirith_ungol.lore: The dark and twisted Spider's Cleft within the mountains of Mordor, watched over by an evil guard-tower.
waypoint.lotr.mornost.lore: A watch-post upon the shadowy spurs of the Ephel DÃºath.
waypoint.lotr.narroth.lore: The Halls of Fire, a watchtower above the pass into the plateau of Gorgoroth.
waypoint.lotr.amon_angren.lore: A dark hill in Mordor, upon which stands a fortress of the NazgÃ»l.
waypoint.lotr.seregost.lore: A fortress in the Mountains of Mordor. The armies of the Easterlings pass through here on the road to Barad-dÃ»r.
waypoint.lotr.vale_of_the_fell_beasts.lo: A dark valley behind the walls of Mordor infested with fell beasts and evil creatures.
waypoint.lotr.eastern_guard.lore: A fortress that keeps watch over the road into Mordor out of RhÃ»n.
waypoint.lotr.fornurnen.lore: The dreary northern shores of the Sea of NÃºrnen.
waypoint.lotr.harnurnen.lore: The bleak southern shores of the Sea of NÃºrnen.
waypoint.lotr.dunurnen.lore: The sad western shores of the Sea of NÃºrnen.
waypoint.lotr.rhunurnen.lore: The dim eastern shores of the Sea of NÃºrnen.
waypoint.lotr.thorband.lore: A terrible prison-fortress of Mordor upon the shores of NÃºrnen.
waypoint.lotr.valley_of_spiders.lore: A grim and shadowy corner of Mordor, infested with the spawn of Ungoliant.
waypoint.lotr.mirulond.lore: The Wine-havens upon the Celduin, where the Avarin Elves of Dorwinion receive shipments from their kin in the Woodland Realm.
waypoint.lotr.vintner_court.lore: The shining centre of all trade, learning, and culture within the Mannish realm of Dorwinion.
waypoint.lotr.golden_ford.lore: A crossing out of Dorwinion into the lands of RhÃºdel.
waypoint.lotr.amon_gwin.lore: A high peak in the hills of Dorwinion.
waypoint.lotr.crossings_of_harnen.lore: This river marks the border of the contested land of Harondor. From here, the road runs on southwards into the vast Sunlands of the Haradwaith.
waypoint.lotr.belkadar.lore: Where the mighty Harnen river meets the Bay of Belfalas stands the greatest stronghold of the Harnedhrim, a rallying-point against their foes to the North.
waypoint.lotr.crossings_of_lithnen.lore: The fords over the river Lithnen and on to eastern lands. Often in ages past were these waters stained red by the conquering swords of Gondor.
waypoint.lotr.gath_azrazain.lore: Un'antica fortezza NÃºmenÃ³reana costruita per sorvegliare le coste. Ã caduta molto tempo fa nelle mani degli Haradrim.
waypoint.lotr.umbar.lore: La fiera cittÃ  dei NÃºmenÃ³reani Neri e dei Corsari, la piÃ¹ vicina ai grandi reami dell'Harad, con una lunga e brutale storia di conflitti contro Gondor.
generator.lotr.me.info: Nasci direttamente nella Terra di Mezzo
generator.lotr.me_classic.info: Nasci direttamente nella Terra di Mezzo con la generazione casuale dei biomi
stat.lotr.interact_faction_crafting_tabl: Interazioni con i tavoli delle fazioni
chat.lotr.respawn.farFromBed: Sei morto lontano dal tuo letto, quindi sei rinato nelle vicinanze di dove sei morto
chat.lotr.respawn.farFromWorldSpawn: Sei morto lontano dallo spawn del mondo, quindi sei rinato nelle vicinanze di dove sei morto
chat.lotr.ft.disabled: Il viaggio rapido Ã¨ disabilitato su questo server
chat.lotr.ft.moreTime: Non puoi ancora viaggiare velocemente verso %s
chat.lotr.ft.underAttack: Non puoi viaggiare velocemente mentre sei sotto attacco
death.attack.lotr.plant: %s Ã¨ stato ucciso da una pianta
death.attack.lotr.stalagmite: %s Ã¨ stato impalato da una stalagmite

commands.lotr.wpcooldown.max.updatedMin: Aggiornato automaticamente il tempo di ricarica minimo per corrispondere al nuovo massimo di %d

commands.lotr.wpcooldown.min.updatedMax: Aggiornato automaticamente il tempo di ricarica massimo per corrispondere al nuovo minimo di %d

commands.lotr.ftclock.set.multiple: Impostato il tempo dall'ultimo viaggio rapido di %d giocatori a %d secondi (%s)
